neighbors.name: Jensen Acres LLC
neighbors.claims: Jensen Acres LLC is a Wisconsin-based entity with a registered mailing address in Arlington, WI (Columbia County), directly bordering the subject area [Town of Vienna Tax Roll](https://www.apraz.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/T.-Vienna-2024-Completed-Real-Estate-Assessment-Roll-1.pdf). Public records indicate the entity is involved in agricultural operations, having been a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=53911&page=1). The entity appears to be a local landholding vehicle rather than the Omaha-based firm previously identified.
neighbors.influence_justification: Low – Appears to be a standard agricultural landholding entity based in neighboring Columbia County; no evidence of significant political activity or public testimony found in Dane County records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a local agricultural landowner. The entity is based in nearby Arlington, WI, suggesting local ties rather than absentee investment. Focus on how development impacts agricultural operations and offers guaranteed revenue.

neighbors.profile_summary: Jensen Acres LLC is a local agricultural landholding entity based in Arlington, WI (Columbia County), owning property in the Town of Vienna.
neighbors.disambiguation: Original draft incorrectly identified this as an Omaha-based entity. Tax records confirm the owner address is in Arlington, WI.

citations.claim: Jensen Acres LLC is a Wisconsin-based entity with a registered mailing address in Arlington, WI (Columbia County)
citations.title: Town of Vienna 2024 Real Estate Assessment Roll
EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Arlington WI

neighbors.name: Shamrock Acres LLC
neighbors.claims: Shamrock Acres LLC shares a registered address with Ripp Farms LLC in Dane, WI, indicating it is an entity controlled by the Ripp family rather than the local dog kennel [Town of Vienna Tax Roll](https://www.apraz.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/T.-Vienna-2024-Completed-Real-Estate-Assessment-Roll-1.pdf). The Ripp family operates Ripp's Dairy Valley and are prominent figures in the local agricultural community [PBS Wisconsin](https://pbswisconsin.org/news-item/why-immigrant-workers-became-the-backbone-of-wisconsins-dairy-business/). The family has a documented history of supporting renewable energy projects, specifically participating as foundational partners in a community anaerobic digester project to produce renewable natural gas [Journal of Nutrient Management](https://jofnm.com/article-317-Focused-on-family-and-the-future.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – The owners (Ripp family) are Master Agriculturists and large-scale dairy operators who have hosted town hall meetings with public officials and 60+ attendees [PBS Wisconsin]. They are active in the Yahara Pride Farms Conservation Board and have publicly advocated for renewable fuel standards.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Ripp family (Keith, Chuck, Troy, or Gary) with a high-level discussion on energy innovation. Acknowledge their existing leadership in renewable energy (biogas digesters) and frame the project as complementary to their sustainability goals.

neighbors.profile_summary: Shamrock Acres LLC is an entity associated with the Ripp family, prominent Dane County dairy farmers (Ripp's Dairy Valley) known for their leadership in agriculture and renewable energy (biogas).
neighbors.disambiguation: Draft incorrectly linked this LLC to Shamrock Acres Kennels/Colleen McCarthy. Tax records confirm the address matches Ripp Farms LLC, a distinct and influential agricultural family.
